<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: for (Iterator<Object> it = col.iterator(); it.hasNext(); ) {
int i = 0;
Object current = it.next();
if (current instanceof java.awt.Component) {
// Perform code on current component
}
if (i > 0) {
Object previous = it.previous();
// Perform code on previous component
}
if (i < col.size() - 1) {
Object next = it.next();
// Perform code on next component
}
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator.next() and Iterator.previous() methods to refer to the current and previous elements during an iteration. In your case, you can store the current and previous components in separate variables and perform the necessary code on them.
